metadata.title: CVE-2016-3154 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
The encoder_contexte_ajax function in ecrire/inc/filtres.php in SPIP 2.x before 2.1.19, 3.0.x before 3.0.22, and 3.1.x before 3.1.1 allows remote attackers to conduct PHP object injection attacks and execute arbitrary PHP code via a crafted serialized object.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-3154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

spip - 3.1.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: spip package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.1-1').
